video.title: Command Line Crash Course
video.description:
Learn the command line, its magic, and how to master this amazing interface.

Talk by Robert Axelsen (@robaxelsen) at the FreeCodeCamp Vienna June 2018 meetup.

Recorded by Pusher.com.

Pusher's channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoyqucxoFXDFnh3khD0rjUg

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: Kristiyan Gerasimov
topLevelComment.text: I'm a storage engineer at IBM. Most of the basic stuff we do is showcased in this video. Amazing to see that Robert Axelsen was able to compress a week-long training into 30 minutes!

replies.author: Ismail Co
replies.text: in Linux you can make files with ~$ mkdir .folder or ~$ touch .file .txt,  just add a dot before the folder/file.

topLevelComment.author: Chiaki Nanami
topLevelComment.text: The Windows Subsystem for Linux has existed for a while now; why does cygwin get a mention in the beginning and that doesn't?

replies.author: mrufa
replies.text: Honestly, does anybody use it? For simple cases bash for Windows/Cygwin are perfectly fine. With more complex, more demanding use cases WSL will most probably fail anyway, due to either lack of given native linux packages support and/or due to atrocious performance issues.
